Compute gasfluxes from dynamic chamber measurements or BLE

Source: vignettes/glimmr.Rmd
glimmr.Rmd

glimmr is an R package that makes it easier to process and handle data from dynamic flux measurements and provides functions to use with the boundary layer Equation (BLE).

(Dynamic-) chamber measurements

Approach

During applications of dynamic chambers, typically two kinds of datasets are created: One continous dataset containing the raw gas mixing ratios and one metadataset with information about the single applications. Typically this contains an ID of the spot location, time of the measurement start (and end) and maybe the chamber temperature.

glimmr reads both datasets, slices the concentration data into chunks defined by the metadata and pases this to gasfluxes::gasfluxes for the actual flux calculation.

The datastructure of the recorderd data can be widely defined, hence glimmr is not restriced to a speceific device. Nevertheless, wrapper functions are included for GASMET and LosGatos gas analizers.

Read data

GASMET and LosGatos records can be directly loaded:

gasmet <- read_gasmet("path/to/gasmet_file.csv")

losgatos <- read_losgatos("path/to/losgatos/dir")
losgatos <- read_losgatos("path/to/losgatos_file.txt")

Single LosGatos files, as well as directories containing zips and txt files are supported. See read_losgatos() for details.

The structure of corresponding metdata is defined as follows:

meta_gasmet
#>      spot        day      start temp wndw offset
#> 1     YT1 2017-04-12 32509 secs  6.9   10      0
#> 2     YT1 2017-04-12 32936 secs  6.9   10      0
#> 3     YT1 2017-04-12 33265 secs  6.9   10      0
#> 4 YTMeteo 2017-04-12 60461 secs  6.3   10      0
#> 5 YTMeteo 2017-04-12 60941 secs  6.3    9      0
#> 6 YTMeteo 2017-04-12 61340 secs  6.3   10      0
meta_losgatos
#>   spot        day    start      end t_start t_end
#> 1   A1 2018-05-23 07:08:00 07:13:00      20    22

Process fluxes

process_chamber(
  # specify data
  losgatos, 
  meta_losgatos,
  #define datastructure
  time_stamp = "Time", 
  conc_columns = c(CH4 = "[CH4]_ppm", CO2 = "[CO2]_ppm"), 
  preassure = "GasP_torr", 
  temperature = "AmbT_C", 
  time_proc = trim_time,
  # use temoperature column in meta file
  manual_temperature = "t_start",
  #define chamber dimensions
  V = 0.01461, 
  A = 0.098
)

For simplification, two devices are predefined and can be called via convenient wrapper functions:

process_losgatos(losgatos, meta_losgatos)

process_gasmet(gasmet, meta_gasmet)
